document.title: Nemerle Homepage
document.motto: But magic, true magic, is worked only by those beings who speak the Hardic tongue of Earthsea, or the Old Speech from which it grew.

body.p: Nemerle is a new hybrid (functional, object-oriented and imperative) programming language for the .NET platform.
Key features of the language include:

ul.li: simplicity
C#-like syntax
easy to use object system (derived directly from the .NET)
easy access to both functional and imperative features
powerful code-generating macros
variants
pattern matching
static and on-demand dynamic typing
type inference.

body.p: From the latest 0.2 release language is a full CLS consumer and producer.
More news can be found in our code blog (or its RSS feed).

We have implemented hygienic macros and lexical scoping of global symbols used in quotations. For detailed description of these features see announcement email and paper about macros.

We have set up a little poll about some design choices we need to make now. You are welcomed to submit your votes and comments.

Mar 09 2004
Ewa Dacko has joined our team as a Technical Writer. Evva, herzlich wilkommen :)

The text of the lecture as well as the exercises for first Nemerle lecture are available.

Feb 24 2004
The 0.1.1 bugfix release is out. Details can be found in release email.

Feb 17 2004
The 0.1.0 version of Nemerle has been released. You can find details in a release email.

Feb 1 2004
The Subversion activity statistics has been made available thanks to CIA. There are also some other statistic available there.

Jan 26 2004
We're heading for the 0.1 release around Feb 15. IL code generator is now fully operational, we also can export and import Nemerle types in DLLs. Macros has undergone much redesign.

Jan 4 2004
Paweł Olszta works on IL code generation using System.Reflection.Emit to replace our current approach with C# compiler in the middle. He was also working on Nemerle type export/import using extended attributes. Michal Moskal has implemented tail recursion elimination, some limited type inference and rewritten parser in Nemerle. Kamil Skalski has been working on macros -- several macros are fully functional now (printf, for, using). He also rewrite lexer in Nemerle. Compiler contains no C# sources any more. Dawid Duda has written few standard library modules.

Nov 26 2003
Cleanups in documentation. Progress is being made in the compiler, particularly in CLS connectivity section (Pawel Olszta) and macros (Kamil Skalski).

Nov 17 2003
Bugtracking system has been set up at http://nemerle.org/bugs/. Activity is monitored in new mailing list bugs/at/nemerle.org.

Oct 29 2003
Jacek Śliwerski has updated hacking.html file to list build requirements. He also updated our build system by adding custom configure script.

Oct 26 2003
ncc can finally bootstrap itself.

Oct 23 2003
Some preliminary development info in hacking.html.
